title: Ukrainian Red Borscht Soup
ingredients: 3 medium baking potatoes, peeled and cubed
½ medium head cabbage, cored and shredded
8 ¾ cups water, divided, or as needed
1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste
½ cup sour cream, for topping
freshly chopped dill or parsley for garnish
method: Step 2: Crumble sausage into a skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until no longer pink. Remove from the heat and set aside.
Step 3: Fill a large pot halfway with water (about 8 cups) and bring to a boil.

Step 4: Add sausage to pot, cover pot, and return to a boil. Add beets and simmer for 10 minutes. Add carrots and potatoes and continue to cook until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes more. Stir in cabbage and tomatoes.
Step 5: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in tomato paste and remaining 3/4 cup water until well blended; transfer to the pot.
Step 6: Add garlic to the soup, cover, and turn off the heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in sugar and season with salt and pepper.
Step 7: Ladle into serving bowls. Garnish with sour cream and dill. Enjoy!
